channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Democrats end boycott of Minnesota House after agreeing power-sharing deal with GOP
item.description: Minnesota House Democrats returned to the state Capitol on Thursday after reaching a power-sharing agreement with Republicans, ending a stalemate that...

item.title: Survey finds 51% of college presidents alarmed by Trump's return
item.description: A little over half of college presidents responding to an annual survey fear that President Trump's second administration will hurt higher education.

item.title: 'Power grab': Jeffries unveils data protection bill amid DOGE crackdown
item.description: House Democrats unveiled legislation on Thursday that seeks to secure the personal data of Americans amid the Department of Government Efficiency's (D...

item.title: Uber CEO says the company is ‘well-positioned’ on autonomous vehicles—but gains are still a long way off
item.description: Chief executive Dara Khosrowshahi said Uber was "well-positioned" as the autonomous-vehicle market heats up.

item.title: 'AI powerhouse': White House encourages Americans to provide ideas for artificial intelligence strategy
item.description: The White House is opening its Artificial Intelligence Plan up to Americans to contribute policy ideas to the Trump administration to ensure that the ...

item.title: What’s the Winning Ingredient in M&A? The Answer Lies in Due Diligence
item.description: The days of due diligence as a box-checking exercise are over.

item.title: Senate DOGE Republican pushes bill to bring government computer systems 'out of the stone age'
item.description: DOGE caucus chair Sen. Joni Ernst, R-Iowa, is pushing for the upper chamber to approve the SOMOSA Act to bring government computer systems up to date.

item.title: The person ruling on Elon Musk’s DOGE conflicts of interest is…Elon Musk
item.description: White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt said Elon Musk will remove himself if overlap between DOGE and companies like SpaceX and Tesla arises.

item.title: ICE hits limit on detention beds, releases migrants
item.description: Homeland Security's deportation agency has bumped up against its detention bed space limit and has begun to release illegal immigrants.

item.title: ‘It’s Gonna Be Taxes’: Kamala Struggled To Explain Funding For $3 Trillion Giveaway In Off-Camera CBS Footage
item.description: Then-Democrat Presidential Nominee Kamala Harris appeared stumped when asked to explain how she would pay for her economic policies aside from taxes i...

item.title: For Investment Leaders: Why You Should Learn to Love Losing

item.title: Conservatives Can’t Allow Wisconsin’s Upcoming Supreme Court Race To Fall Through The Cracks
item.description: 'This crucial election has national impacts and will require national support,' said Sen. Ron Johnson, R-Wis.

item.title: Trump Must Put an End to Biden’s Environmental Injustice
item.description: Nobody did this to you, environmental activists. You did it to yourselves.

item.title: Did Real Assets Provide an Inflation Hedge When Investors Needed it Most?
item.description: Real assets' first test in modern times started in 2021. Did they perform as hoped?

item.title: A new bill would ban DeepSeek from government devices because hidden code reveals the AI app could send data to a Chinese telecom: ‘This should be a no-brainer’
item.description: DeepSeek had a sudden rise to popularity after it launched a powerful AI model that it said had been trained extremely cheaply.

item.title: Trump must dump 'One China' policy and recognize 'free' Taiwan, House Republicans say
item.description: Two dozen House Republicans from across the political spectrum are backing a resolution to formally recognize Taiwan – a break in U.S. policy that wou...

item.title: Here’s How Trump’s Department Of Transportation Can Make It Easier For Americans To Start Families
item.description: Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy signed a memo reorienting all federal transportation funding toward supporting marriage and families.

item.title: Snap CEO Evan Spiegel mocks Mark Zuckerberg on LinkedIn—says he’s ‘VP Product’ at Meta because of all the features Facebook and Instagram have replicated from his app
item.description: Instagram has made its own versions of the stories and face filters pioneered by Snapchat.

item.title: Birthright Citizenship: The Supreme Court Precedents Loom Large
item.description: Trump can only win his case by getting the Supreme Court to overrule its own precedent or reject its reasoning.

item.title: Beyond the Hype: Do Hedge Funds Deliver Value?
item.description: Skill and alpha are scarce and difficult to obtain in the hedge fund market.

item.title: Trump Repairs the U.S.-Israel Relationship

item.title: How Michael Kors owner Capri made a $675 million mistake by waiting in vain for a white knight
item.description: Meanwhile, Coach and Ralph Lauren continue to kill it.

item.title: Book Review: The Making of Modern Corporate Finance
item.description: Donald Chew delivers a love letter to unfettered capitalism and the financial system that oils the gears of commerce.

item.title: Congressional Committee Wants Data FBI Claimed Was ‘Corrupted’ In Unsolved J6 Pipe Bomb Case
item.description: At minimum, the FBI should be able to articulate where its investigations led.

item.title: Trump Ate My Climate Plan
item.description: By withdrawing from the Paris accord, Trump is offering a number of nations a helpful excuse for dodging commitments they had little intention of keep...

item.title: Federal judge pauses Trump's federal worker buyout plan
item.description: A federal judge in Boston on Thursday temporarily halted the Trump administration's mass buyout plan for federal workers.

item.title: Try Telling This Dad Whose Daughter Was Killed By An Illegal That Open Borders Are ‘Compassionate’
item.description: Police say 20-year-old Katie Abraham was killed in a Jan. 19 car crash by a drunk driver, allegedly an illegal immigrant with a false identity.
